column4: yeah i looked at that, i was hoping there was a more clear cut article, but i'll look at that again
do you know whether MobileMe is using a POP or iMap server?
take a look at this link: 'http://www.neowin.net/forum/index.php?showtopic=658662" It seems to discuss what you are looking for. Let me know...
it works thanks
so I assume MobileMe is using an Imap server?
it can use pop3 but you have to contact mobileme support to enable it - i like imap more anyways
yeah me too
you use .mac too?
No but I am a Mac user. I traded a friend an old iMac (G3) for an everex Laptop so I decided to check out Ubuntu with it...
cool, get debian on there... better mac support i think
still trying to get a handle on Ubuntu not sure if I want to add another dimension to this learning experience I've been having...
debian isn't that much harder
Probably not it just took way too much time to get Ubuntu isntalled on this machine due to the video card (driver) issues. Dont think I want to relive that again. For example:
oh... the worst video driver issue i had was gentoo live 2008.1 set my X with radeon drivers which doesn't work with my card

no such luck here with vesa or openchrome. Had to do a text based install with Hardy alternate CD then do update via terminal/console all the while my  by hands were being held these great chaps on the forum...
Linux is still a new world for me so I want to tread slowly. My intention is to get my children used to using Ubuntu/Edubuntu as well the Mac & PC so I'm concentrating on Ubuntu for now.
good idea, is there a big difference with edubuntu than ubuntu?
do you know of any resources for mac users entering into the Linux/Ubuntu environment. It may be easier to get some work down by mimicing the OS X environment in the beginning
not to sure as I erased it off the computer when I first got it but it seems like a wonderful resource for learning and my children are all doing on line school (k12.com)
there is a project to make a linux machine look like a mac graphically
i would do a dual boot ubuntu and mac os x system
meaning install OS X (10.5) onto this laptop (everex stepnote NC1502)?
look at the private chat i initiated
will do
